Package com.example.qrhunterapp_t11

Class CameraFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      • com.example.qrhunterapp_t11.fragments.CameraFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner
    public class CameraFragment
extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
    Logic for the camera fragment, which is responsible for managing everything that pertains to scanning and adding a new QR code. Calls all the necessary activities for achieving this (the scan QR and take photo activities).

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment

        androidx.fragment.app.Fragment.InstantiationException, androidx.fragment.app.Fragment.SavedState

                                      android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Inflates the layout for the camera fragment.
        Overrides:
        onCreateView in class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
        Parameters:
        inflater - The LayoutInflater object that can be used to inflate any views in the fragment,
        container - If non-null, this is the parent view that the fragment's UI should be attached to. The fragment should not add the view itself, but this can be used to generate the LayoutParams of the view.
        savedInstanceState - If non-null, this fragment is being re-constructed from a previous saved state as given here.
        Returns:
        a View containing the inflated layout.

      • onViewCreated

        public void onViewCreated​(@NonNull
                          android.view.View view,
                          @Nullable
                          android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Once the layout view is initialized, call the function to scan a code. Having a view for the camera fragment may be redundant at the moment (since it's never really used), but will keep this for now in case we need to display something in the layout later.

        Also for some reason scanCode() must be called here or the app will crash.

        Overrides:
        onViewCreated in class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
        Parameters:
        view - The View returned by onCreateView(LayoutInflater, ViewGroup, Bundle).
        savedInstanceState - If non-null, this fragment is being re-constructed from a previous saved state as given here.

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate​(@Nullable
                     android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Called when fragment is being initialized. Creates a dialog that displays the score of the scanned QR code. The dialog disappears automatically after a few seconds.
        Overrides:
        onCreate in class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - If the fragment is being re-created from a previous saved state, this is the state.

      • scanCode

        private void scanCode()
        Function to initialize QR scanner options, and order the QR scanner to start scanning using the CaptureAct.

      • promptForPhoto

        private void promptForPhoto()
        Creates a dialog for whether the user would like to take a photo of the object or location of the QR code. If the user selects "no", this step will be skipped and the user's geo-location will be prompted next.

      • takePhoto

        private void takePhoto()
        Helper function that starts the TakePhotoActivity if the user accepts the photo prompt.

      • connectGoogleApiClient

        private void connectGoogleApiClient()
        Connects the GoogleApiClient and initiates the permissions check

      • getCurrentLocation

        private void getCurrentLocation()
        Retrieves the current location and logs the latitude and longitude of the location. Adds QRCode to db with location and returns to profile TODO: adding location data to the QRCode is currently disabled due to a bug when displaying QR's on profile w/ location data Adds QRCode to db and returns to profile

      • permissions

        private void permissions()
        Initiates the location permission check and logs if permission is already granted

      • onRequestPermissionsResult

        public void onRequestPermissionsResult​(int requestCode,
                                       @NonNull
                                       java.lang.String[] permissions,
                                       @NonNull
                                       int[] grantResults)
        Handles the user's response to the location permission request. Calls getCurrentLocation() if permission is granted, otherwise adds QRCode to db with location=null and returns to profile.
        Overrides:
        onRequestPermissionsResult in class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
        Parameters:
        requestCode - The request code of the permission request.
        permissions - The requested permissions.
        grantResults - The results of the permission request.

      • promptForLocation

        private void promptForLocation()
        Prompts the user as to whether they would like to share their geolocation for a QR code. If they click "yes", the QR code will be created with location, and if they press "no" without location.

      • returnToProfile

        private void returnToProfile()
        Helper function to return to profile screen once user has finished adding a QR code. Otherwise if a user tried to add another QR code immediately after scanning one, since they're technically still in the CameraFragment, nothing would happen.

      • addQRCode

        private void addQRCode()
        Helper function to add QRCode object to QRCodes and Users collections
